00077   class SessionCallback {

00084 
00085   /*
00086    * %Hyperspace session.  Provides the API for %Hyperspace, a namespace and
00087    * lock service.  This service is modeled after
00088    * <a href="http://labs.google.com/papers/chubby.html">Chubby</a>.
00089    * Presently it is implemented as just a single server, but ultimately
00090    * it will get re-written using a distributed consensus protocol for high
00091    * availablility.  For now, it provides the same functionality (albeit less
00092    * available) and the same API.
00093    * This allows us to get the system up and running and since the API is the
00094    * same as the API for the highly-available version, minimal code changes
00095    * will be needed when we swap out this one for the highly available one.
00096    * <p>
00097    * %Session establishes a session with the master which includes a TCP
00098    * connection and the initiation of regular heartbeat UDP messages.  As soon
00099    * as the master receives the first heartbeat message from the client
00100    * %Session object, it creates the session and grants a lease. Each heartbeat
00101    * that the master receives from the client causes the master to extend the
00102    * lease.  In this mode of operation, the session is in the SAFE state.  If
00103    * the master does not receive a heartbeat message before the lease
00104    * expiration time, then the session transitions to the EXPIRED state and
00105    * the master drops the session.
00106    * <p>
00107    * Whenever the client receives a heartbeat UDP response message, it advances
00108    * its conservative estimate of what it thinks the lease expiration time is.
00109    * If the lease expires, then the client will put the session in the JEOPARDY
00110    * state and will continue sending heartbeats for a period of time known as
00111    * the 'grace period'. During the JEOPARDY state, all %Hyperspace commands
00112    * are suspended.  If a heartbeat response message is received during the
00113    * grace period, then it will switch back to SAFE mode and allow pending
00114    * commands to proceed.  Otherwise, the session expires.
00115    * <p>
00116    * The following set of properties are available to configure the protocol
00117    * (default values are shown):
00118    * <pre>
00119    * Hyperspace.Lease.Interval=20
00120    * Hyperspace.KeepAlive.Interval=10
00121    * Hyperspace.GracePeriod=60
00122    * </pre>
00123    */
00124   class Session : public ReferenceCount {
00125 
00126   public:
00127 
00131     enum State {
00133       STATE_EXPIRED,
00135       STATE_JEOPARDY,
00137       STATE_SAFE
00138     };
